Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of part of naked male (head, right arm and most of legs missing) in quasi three-quarter view to right, left arm raised; horse (head and forequarters missing; added white tail) to right with part of rider (lower back and thigh; white on chiton) with spear, seen below horse's belly; below, glazed area; ancient repair hole.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0523) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
